titleStmt.title: A view of valyaunce Describing the famous feates, and martiall exploites of two most mightie nations, the Romains and the Carthaginians, for the conquest and possession of Spayne. Translated out of an auncient recorde of antiquitie, written by Rutilius Rufus, a Romaine Gentleman, and a Capitaine of charge vnder Scipio, in the same warres. Very delightfull to reade, and neuer before this time publyshed.
titleStmt.author: Newton, Thomas, 1542?-1607.

notesStmt.note: Rutilius Rufus is a pseudonym for Thomas Newton.
Leaves marked, stained, creased and torn.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
